string-array.item: Remind me that I must die, so I grow wise.
Don\'t regret growing older. Its a privilege denied to many.
Live simply so that others may simply live.
Death is something inevitable. When a man has done what he considers to be his duty to his people and his country, he can rest in peace.
On the contrary, death is the ultimate fairness; rich and poor, young and old, all are equal in death.
The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others.
Yesterday is history. Tomorrow is a mystery. Today is a gift. That\'s why it\'s called the present.
Being sad with the right people is better than being happy with the wrong ones.
You have enemies? Good. That means you\'ve stood up for something, sometime in your life.
You are only young once, but you can be immature forever.
Worrying is like a rocking chair: it gives you something to do, but doesn\'t get you anywhere.
When another person makes you suffer, it is because he suffers deeply within himself, and his suffering is spilling over. He does not need punishment; he needs help.
Don\'t fear failure. - Not failure, but low aim, is the crime. In great attempts it is glorious even to fail.
Not all of us can do great things. But we can do small things with great love.
Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.
Evil prevails when good men fail to act.
It is not death that a man should fear, but he should fear never beginning to live.
Even death is not to be feared by one who has lived wisely.
If a man has not discovered something that he will die for he isn\'t fit to live.
All you have to decide is what to do with the time that is given to you.
Many that live deserve death. Some that die deserve life. Do not be too eager to deal out death in judgement. Even the very wise cannot see all ends.
Change your life today. Don\'t gamble on the future, act now, without delay.
Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance, you must keep moving.
Do not take life too seriously. You will never get out of it alive.
